Package auditorium

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IAuditoriumHost
    Abstraction of the interface between a layer and its AuditoriumHost.
    IAuditoriumLayer
    Layers: In an auditorium implementation, each layer is a stage which a message must go through both when it is sent by a host and received by a host.
    IAuditoriumParams
    These are configuration constants that auditorium needs.
    IKeyStore
    The auditorium integrity layer intefaces with an instance of this type in order to access keys that are stored somehow.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AAuditoriumLayer
    This base class is extended by all auditorium layers.
    AuditoriumDiscoveryHost
    This class implements the auditorium discovery protocol.
    AuditoriumHost
    This is the top level class that an application should interface with if it wishes to use auditorium.

    In addition to providing the library API for accessing the auditorium network, this class is the keeper of three threads.
    AuditoriumHost.Pair
    Messages that get passed to the application layer are wrapped with a pointer to the host that they came from.
    AuditoriumIntegrityLayer
    This layer handles signatures.
    AuditoriumTemporalLayer
    This layer deals with temporality assertions in announcements.
    Bugout
    This class contains debugging output messages (which might, someday, get turned into logs).
    Cert
    This class represents a certificate, which is essentially a signed key.
    Event<T>  
    Generator
    Use an instance of this class to generate RSA keys.
    Generator.Keys
    A public/private key pair.
    HostPointer
    An instance of this class simply wraps an ID, IP and port together.
    Key
    This class represents one half of an asymmetric cryptographic key; as such it can be used for signing, as well as either encryption or decryption.
    Link
    This class represents a single link in the group of outgoing links from a given host.
    Log
    Log's job is to serialize messages that are heard over auditorium.
    Message
    An instance of this class represents an auditorium wire message.
    MessagePointer
    This class represents the ptr auditorium data structure.
    MessageSocket
    This class wraps a socket that interfaces with the outside world in the form of Message instances.
    RSACrypto
    Crypto primitives used in auditorium are wrapped here.
    Signature
    This class represents the auditorium signature data structure.
    SimpleKeyStore
    Simple keystore implementation which looks for keys and certificates in a specified directory.
    SynchronizedQueue<T>
    This is an implementation of a synchronized queue (LIFO push/pop policy) which holds S-Exprssions.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    AuditoriumCryptoException
    This class wraps an exception that happens as a result of a crypto operation.
    FatalNetworkException
    This is thrown if Auditorium has found an unrecoverable error.
    IncorrectFormatException
    This exception is thrown when Auditorium expects an s-expression to be formatted a particular way, but it isn't.
    LayerNotFoundException
    The layer that has been requested by name cannot be found.
    NetworkException
    This is thrown if auditorium has encountered a recoverable error.
    ReleasedQueueException
    This is thrown when a queue has determined it cannot get any more input.
    SignerValidityException
    Class representing an exception that resulted from an error in the signing chain of a certificate or other signed artifact.
